events.name: Capture of El Chapo's Son, Ovidio Guzman-Lopez, in Mexico
events.wd_label: Capture of El Chapo's Son, Ovidio Guzman-Lopez, in Mexico
events.wd_description: Ovidio Guzman-Lopez, the son of Mexican drug kingpin "El Chapo," was captured in Culiacan, leading to intense violence that resulted in the deaths of 24 people, including military officers and cartel members.
events.description: Ovidio Guzman-Lopez, the son of Mexican drug kingpin "El Chapo," was captured in Culiacan, leading to intense violence that resulted in the deaths of 24 people, including military officers and cartel members.

events.name: Capture of Guzman-Lopez
events.wd_description: Ovidio Guzman-Lopez, son of "El Chapo" and leader of his father's former cartel, was captured in Culiacan and flown to Mexico City after a violent confrontation.
events.description: Ovidio Guzman-Lopez, son of "El Chapo" and leader of his father's former cartel, was captured in Culiacan and flown to Mexico City after a violent confrontation.

events.name: Violent Retaliation by Cartel
events.wd_description: The capture of Guzman-Lopez led to violent retaliation from cartel members, resulting in the deaths of 10 military officers and 19 suspects, with additional attacks including burning vehicles and firing at planes.
events.description: The capture of Guzman-Lopez led to violent retaliation from cartel members, resulting in the deaths of 10 military officers and 19 suspects, with additional attacks including burning vehicles and firing at planes.

events.name: US Involvement in Operation
events.wd_description: The United States was involved in the six-month surveillance operation that led to the capture of Guzman-Lopez, highlighting international cooperation in the effort.
events.description: The United States was involved in the six-month surveillance operation that led to the capture of Guzman-Lopez, highlighting international cooperation in the effort.

events.name: Blocked Extradition
events.wd_description: A Mexican federal judge blocked the extradition of Guzman-Lopez to the United States, preventing his immediate transfer.
events.description: A Mexican federal judge blocked the extradition of Guzman-Lopez to the United States, preventing his immediate transfer.

events.name: Wildfires Ravage Central Chile, Prompting International Aid
events.wd_label: Wildfires Ravage Central Chile, Prompting International Aid
events.wd_description: Dozens of wildfires have swept across central Chile, killing at least 23 people, destroying 800 homes, and leading to a state of emergency in three regions. The fires have highlighted the impact of climate change, prompting international aid.
events.description: Dozens of wildfires have swept across central Chile, killing at least 23 people, destroying 800 homes, and leading to a state of emergency in three regions. The fires have highlighted the impact of climate change, prompting international aid.

events.name: Wildfires in Central Chile
events.wd_description: Wildfires have erupted across central Chile, affecting sparsely populated regions with large tracts of forest land and agricultural farms, resulting in widespread destruction and loss of life.
events.description: Wildfires have erupted across central Chile, affecting sparsely populated regions with large tracts of forest land and agricultural farms, resulting in widespread destruction and loss of life.

events.name: Impact and Emergency Declaration
events.wd_description: The wildfires have caused the deaths of at least 23 people, destroyed 800 homes, and injured 66 others, leading to the declaration of a state of emergency in three regions.
events.description: The wildfires have caused the deaths of at least 23 people, destroyed 800 homes, and injured 66 others, leading to the declaration of a state of emergency in three regions.

events.name: International Aid Response
events.wd_description: In response to the wildfires, several countries, including Spain, the United States, and Argentina, have offered assistance in the form of aircraft, firefighters, and equipment to help combat the fires.
events.description: In response to the wildfires, several countries, including Spain, the United States, and Argentina, have offered assistance in the form of aircraft, firefighters, and equipment to help combat the fires.

events.name: Vladimir Putin's Surprise Visit to Mariupol
events.wd_label: Vladimir Putin's Surprise Visit to Mariupol
events.wd_description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made an unannounced visit to the captured Ukrainian port city of Mariupol, marking his first trip to Russian-occupied territories in Ukraine since the invasion began, shortly after the ICC issued an arrest warrant for him.
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made an unannounced visit to the captured Ukrainian port city of Mariupol, marking his first trip to Russian-occupied territories in Ukraine since the invasion began, shortly after the ICC issued an arrest warrant for him.

events.name: Putin's Visit to Mariupol
events.wd_description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made a surprise visit to Mariupol, the first time he has visited Russian-occupied territories in Ukraine since the invasion began, following the ICC's issuance of an arrest warrant for him.
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made a surprise visit to Mariupol, the first time he has visited Russian-occupied territories in Ukraine since the invasion began, following the ICC's issuance of an arrest warrant for him.

events.name: Significance of Mariupol in the War
events.wd_label: Significance of Mariupol in the War
events.wd_description: Mariupol, which fell in May 2022 after one of the bloodiest battles of the war, was Russia's first major victory in its invasion of Ukraine, after failing to capture Kyiv.
events.description: Mariupol, which fell in May 2022 after one of the bloodiest battles of the war, was Russia's first major victory in its invasion of Ukraine, after failing to capture Kyiv.

events.name: Meeting with Russian Military Leadership
events.wd_description: After visiting Mariupol, Putin traveled to Rostov, where he met with Valery Gerasimov, the chief of the general staff and a key commander in Russia's war effort in Ukraine.
events.description: After visiting Mariupol, Putin traveled to Rostov, where he met with Valery Gerasimov, the chief of the general staff and a key commander in Russia's war effort in Ukraine.

events.name: Increase in North America’s EV battery manufacturing capacity
events.wd_label: Increase in North America’s EV battery manufacturing capacity
events.wd_description: A significant increase in North America's battery manufacturing capacity from 55 GWh/year in 2021 to nearly 1,000 GWh/year by 2030. This expansion is expected to support the production of 10 to 13 million all-electric vehicles annually by 2030.
events.description: A significant increase in North America's battery manufacturing capacity from 55 GWh/year in 2021 to nearly 1,000 GWh/year by 2030. This expansion is expected to support the production of 10 to 13 million all-electric vehicles annually by 2030.

events.name: Planned battery plant projects
events.wd_description: Most of the battery plant projects in North America are scheduled to begin production between 2025 and 2030.
events.description: Most of the battery plant projects in North America are scheduled to begin production between 2025 and 2030.

events.name: Co-location with automotive plants
events.wd_description: Many battery plants will be co-located with automotive plants to optimize supply chain logistics.
events.description: Many battery plants will be co-located with automotive plants to optimize supply chain logistics.

events.name: t: Concentration of projects in specific states
events.wd_label: t: Concentration of projects in specific states
events.wd_description: The highest growth in battery manufacturing capacity is expected in Kentucky, Tennessee, Georgia, and Michigan.
events.description: The highest growth in battery manufacturing capacity is expected in Kentucky, Tennessee, Georgia, and Michigan.
